page.title: 18A Day in my life in Kinver
page.content:
When I get up at 7.30 I walk over to the window, half asleep, half awake, but as soon as I smell the really fresh air I feel alive. The thing that catches my attention the most is the birds singing and the horses eating. At about 8.30 I walk to school with my sister. As I walk past the old shops and houses I realise what a pretty village Kinver is. At last I get to school. My lessons seem to drag a bit but at 3.30 I walk home with my sister. We always go in a really old shop and buy some sweets or an ice-cream. Just before we get home we always walk up this alley where there's a very old house with beams on it. Beside the house are rocks with really big trees and pretty flowers.
(Continued on page 19)
